title: How to Convert Zip to Exe

steps.title: Download Paquet Builder from https://www.installpackbuilder.com/download.
steps.content: Download Paquet Builder from https://www.installpackbuilder.com/download . To begin the download, click Download Now . A file called “pbinst.exe” will download to your computer.

steps.title: Run the installer.
steps.content: Run the installer. To do this, open your Downloads folder, double-click pbinst.exe , and then follow the prompts to complete the installation.

steps.title: To make the conversion easier, download the menu extension from https://www.installpackbuilder.com/explorer-menu-extension.
steps.content: To make the conversion easier, download the menu extension from https://www.installpackbuilder.com/explorer-menu-extension . Once the page loads, click the Download button that displays your version of Windows (32 or 64-bit). A file called “pbextsetup.exe” will download to your computer.

steps.title: Run the menu extension installer.
steps.content: Run the menu extension installer. Open your Downloads folder again, double-click pbextsetup.exe to run the wizard, then follow the prompts to complete the installation.

steps.title: Press ⊞ Win+E.
steps.content: Press ⊞ Win + E . The File Explorer will appear.

steps.title: Browse to the folder that contains the .Zip you want to convert.
steps.content: Browse to the folder that contains the .Zip you want to convert. Don't do anything else just yet.

steps.title: Use the right mouse button to click the ZIP file once.
steps.content: Use the right mouse button to click the ZIP file once. A menu will appear.

steps.title: Click Compress into a Self-Extracting .exe with the left mouse button.
steps.content: Click Compress into a Self-Extracting .exe with the left mouse button. It’s near the center of the menu. This opens Paquet Builder.

steps.title: Enter a title and description for the .exe.
steps.content: Enter a title and description for the .exe. If you want to password-protect the file, type a password into the “Optional Encryption Password” box.

steps.title: Click Build.
steps.content: Click Build . It’s at the bottom-right corner of the window.

steps.title: Click Use Freeware Edition.
steps.content: Click Use Freeware Edition . This begins the conversion. Once the process is complete, a new file will appear in the current folder with the same name, except instead of ending with .Zip, it will end in .Exe.
